unnormalised: **Environmental News: Air Quality Concerns Persist in Delhi-NCR**
normalised: **Environmental News: Air Quality Concerns Persist in Delhi-N C R**

unnormalised: New Delhi – Air quality in the Delhi-NCR region remains a significant concern as winter approaches, exacerbating existing pollution levels. The Central Pollution Control Board (CPCB) reported an Air Quality Index (AQI) consistently hovering in the "poor" to "very poor" category over the past week.
normalised: New Delhi – Air quality in the Delhi-N C R region remains a significant concern as winter approaches, exacerbating existing pollution levels. The Central Pollution Control Board (C P C B) reported an Air Quality Index (A Q I) consistently hovering in the "poor" to "very poor" category over the past week.

unnormalised: Experts attribute the deteriorated air quality to a combination of factors, including vehicular emissions, industrial activities, and stubble burning in neighboring states like Punjab and Haryana. The upcoming festival season, particularly Diwali, raises further anxieties regarding potential spikes in pollution due to firecracker usage.
normalised: Experts attribute the deteriorated air quality to a combination of factors, including vehicular emissions, industrial activities, and stubble burning in neighboring states like Punjab and Haryana. The upcoming festival season, particularly Diwali, raises further anxieties regarding potential spikes in pollution due to firecracker usage.

unnormalised: Dr. Lakshmi Sharma of the Indian Institute of Technology (IIT) Delhi, specializing in atmospheric sciences, cautioned that prolonged exposure to such levels of pollution can lead to severe respiratory problems, especially among children and the elderly.
normalised: Doctor Lakshmi Sharma of the Indian Institute of Technology (I I T) Delhi, specializing in atmospheric sciences, cautioned that prolonged exposure to such levels of pollution can lead to severe respiratory problems, especially among children and the elderly.

unnormalised: Efforts are underway by the Delhi government, including enhanced monitoring and enforcement of existing regulations. Residents are encouraged to utilize public transport, carpool, and avoid burning waste. This year, as people across Kerala are celebrating Onam with delicious feasts, even enjoying a plate of Biryani, let us resolve to adopt sustainable lifestyles that protect our environment. The CPCB advises individuals to check the real-time AQI and take necessary precautions.
normalised: Efforts are underway by the Delhi government, including enhanced monitoring and enforcement of existing regulations. Residents are encouraged to utilize public transport, carpool, and avoid burning waste. This year, as people across Kerala are celebrating Onam with delicious feasts, even enjoying a plate of Biryani, let us resolve to adopt sustainable lifestyles that protect our environment. The C P C B advises individuals to check the real-time A Q I and take necessary precautions.
